prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Metal Plate with Central Hole Construct a rectangular metal plate with a central cylindrical hole. The overall shape is a rectangle with a slightly tapered edge along its length. The central hole is cylindrical and located near the center of the rectangle. The model is symmetrical along its central axis (the y-axis). Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 1 with the following properties: - Euler Angles: 0.0, 0.0, -90.0 (rotate around the z-axis, then the x-axis, and finally the y-axis) - Translation Vector: 0.0, 0.0796, 0.0 Sketch on Face 1: Create a 2D sketch on the XY plane (face 1) with the following shapes and constraints: 1. A rectangle with 4 vertices defined as: - Vertex 1 (0.0, 0.0858) - Vertex 2 (0.4776, 0.0858) - Vertex 3 (0.4776, 0.7415) - Vertex 4 (0.0, 0.7415) 2. This rectangle is then tapered to create the slightly tapered edge. 3. Draw a circle at the center of the rectangle with a radius of 0.1194 and centered at (0.2388, 0.375). This circle is the opening of the central hole. 4. Draw a smaller circle inside the previously drawn circle, with a radius of 0.0531 and centered at the same coordinates (0.2388, 0.375). Sketch on Face 2: Create a 2D sketch on the YZ plane (face 2) with the following shapes and constraints: 1. A circle with a radius of 0.1194 and centered at (0.2388, 0.375). 2. A smaller circle inside the previously drawn circle, with a radius of 0.0531 and centered at the same coordinates (0.2388, 0.375). Extrusion: Extrude the sketches along the normal direction (Z axis) to create the 3D shape with the following properties: - Extrude depth towards the normal: 0.0796 - Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 - Scaling parameter: 0.75 Perform the "New Body Feature Operation" to create the final 3D shape and save it as part 1. Part 2: Cylindrical Object with Tapered Top and Bottom Construct a cylindrical object with a slightly tapered top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 2 with the following properties: - Euler Angles: 0.0, 0.0, -90.0 - Translation Vector: 0.1194, 0.0796, 0.2556 Sketch on Face 1: Create a 2D sketch on the XY plane (face 1) with the following shapes and constraints: 1. A circle with a radius of 0.1194 and centered at the origin (0, 0). 2. A smaller circle inside the previously drawn circle, with a radius of 0.0531 and centered at the same origin (0, 0). Extrusion: Extrude the sketches along the normal direction (Z axis) to create the 3D shape with the following properties: - Extrude depth towards the normal: 0.0 - Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0398 - Scaling parameter: 0.2388 Perform the "Join Feature Operation" with part 1 to add the cylindrical shape to part 1 and save it as the final CAD model.</description>
completion:
<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.0796,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"arc_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0858],"Mid Point":[0.2388,0.0],"End Point":[0.4776,0.0858]},"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.4776,0.0858],"End Point":[0.3184,0.7415]},"arc_2":{"Start Point":[0.3184,0.7415],"Mid Point":[0.2388,0.75],"End Point":[0.1592,0.7415]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.1592,0.7415],"End Point":[0.0,0.0858]}},"loop_2":{"circle_1":{"Center":[0.2388,0.375],"Radius":0.1194}},"loop_3":{"circle_1":{"Center":[0.2388,0.6138],"Radius":0.0314}}},"face_2":{"loop_1":{"circle_1":{"Center":[0.2388,0.375],"Radius":0.1194}},"loop_2":{"circle_1":{"Center":[0.2388,0.375],"Radius":0.0531}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.0796,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}},"part_2":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.1194,0.0796,0.2556]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"circle_1":{"Center":[0.1194,0.1194],"Radius":0.1194}},"loop_2":{"circle_1":{"Center":[0.1194,0.1194],"Radius":0.0531}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.0,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0398,"sketch_scale":0.2388,"operation":"JoinFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism The first part of the CAD assembly is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and meet at right angles. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 3 units by 4 units. Step 1: Create a new coordinate system Start by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.5, 0.0] Step 2: Draw the 2D sketch On the XY plane of the new coordinate system, perform the following operations to create the 2D sketch for the first part: 1. Draw a line from point [0.0, 0.0] to point [0.75, 0.0]. 2. Draw a line from point [0.75, 0.0] to point [0.75, 0.5]. 3. Draw a line from point [0.75, 0.5] to point [0.5, 0.5]. 4. Draw a line from point [0.5, 0.5] to point [0.5, 0.125]. 5. Draw a line from point [0.5, 0.125] to point [0.25, 0.125]. 6. Draw a line from point [0.25, 0.125] to point [0.25, 0.5]. 7. Draw a line from point [0.25, 0.5] to point [0.0, 0.5]. 8. Close the loop by drawing a line from point [0.0, 0.5] to point [0.0, 0.0]. Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75 in all directions. Step 4: Transform the 2D sketch to 3D Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the following parameters: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.5, 0.0] Step 5: Extrude the sketch Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis by a depth of 0.5 units to form the 3D model. This will result in a three-dimensional rectangular prism with the specified dimensions.</description>
completion:
<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.5,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.5]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.5],"End Point":[0.5,0.5]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.5,0.5],"End Point":[0.5,0.125]},"line_5":{"Start Point":[0.5,0.125],"End Point":[0.25,0.125]},"line_6":{"Start Point":[0.25,0.125],"End Point":[0.25,0.5]},"line_7":{"Start Point":[0.25,0.5],"End Point":[0.0,0.5]},"line_8":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.5],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.5,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism with a Curved Side Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side. The prism is centered on the white background. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.1875, 0.0] 2. Create a face (face_1) and a loop (loop_1) consisting of 4 lines in the following order: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.1406] - Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.1406], End Point [0.0, 0.1406] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.1406], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Part 2: Cylindrical Object with a Smaller Cylindrical Hole Create a cylindrical object with a smaller cylindrical hole in the center. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0938, 0.0606, 0.1406] 2. Prepare four faces (face_1, face_2, face_3, and face_4) with the following loops: For face_1 and face_2, create a loop (loop_1) with three curves in the following order: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0331], End Point [0.0469, 0.0331] - Arc 1: Start Point [0.0469, 0.0331], Mid Point [0.08, 0.0], End Point [0.0, 0.0331] - Line 2: [optional - only for face_2] Start Point [0.0469, 0.0331], End Point [0.0, 0.0331] For face_3, create a loop (loop_1) with three curves in the following order: - Line 1: Start Point [0.5156, 0.0331], End Point [0.5625, 0.0331] - Arc 1: Start Point [0.5625, 0.0331], Mid Point [0.4825, 0.0], End Point [0.5156, 0.08] - Line 2: Start Point [0.5156, 0.08], End Point [0.5156, 0.0331] For face_4, create a loop (loop_1) with three curves in the following order: - Line 1: Start Point [0.5156, 0.0331], End Point [0.5625, 0.0331] - Arc 1: Start Point [0.5625, 0.0331], Mid Point [0.5488, 0.0663], End Point [0.5156, 0.08] - Line 2: Start Point [0.5156, 0.08], End Point [0.5156, 0.0331] Final CAD Model The final shape is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height. The prism is centered in the image.</description>

Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the following euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.2045, 0.0] Extrude the 3D sketch to generate the first intermediate CAD part with the following properties: * Extrude depth towards the normal: 0.2455 * Extrude depth opposite the normal: 0.0 * Sketch scale: 0.5455 * Operation: Create a new solid body **Intermediate CAD Part 2: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom** Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 2 with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0886, 0.2045, 0.0886] Next, create a 2D sketch on the X-Z plane of the coordinate system. prompt: <description>**Part 1: Long, Rectangular, Cylindrical Object with a Flat Top and Bottom** The first part is a long, rectangular, cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom. It has a smooth surface and appears to be made of a solid material. The object is symmetrical along its length and has a slightly tapered shape. **Step 1: Create the coordinate system** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.75, 0.0] **Step 2: Draw the 2D sketch** Create a new 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. **Step 3: Create the loops and faces** The sketch consists of a single face (face\\_1) with a single loop (loop\\_1). The loop is closed and has the following curves: - line\\_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.05, 0.0] - line\\_2: Start Point [0.05, 0.0], End Point [0.05, 0.0417] - line\\_3: Start Point [0.05, 0.0417], End Point [0.025, 0.0417] - line\\_4: Start Point [0.025, 0.0417], End Point [0.025, 0.0667] - line\\_5: Start Point [0.025, 0.0667], End Point [0.0, 0.0667] - line\\_6: Start Point [0.0, 0.0667], End Point [0.0, 0.0] **Step 4: Scale the 2D sketch** Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.0667. **Step 5: Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch** Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the Euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. **Step 6: Extrude the 2D sketch** Extrude the 2D sketch along its normal direction by a depth of 0.75 units. The opposite direction extrusion depth is 0.0. This will create a solid body. **Step 7: Finalize the part** The final part should have the following dimensions: - Length: 0.0667 - Width: 0.75 - Height: 0.0667</description>
